programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in the Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by his friend, fellow B&B owner Jeronime Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson host at the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough, where Julie and James are not impressed by the dated bathrooms.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Julie and James host at the Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, where the guests are impressed by their rooms, but once again luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime want more from their beds.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Townhead Hotel in Lockerbie, owned by Stephen Montgomery, where the high level of finish in the rooms surprises all of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Jeronime from Rooms 36 want to find out why their luxury B&B didn't hit the mark as the B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Canadian comedian Larah hosts the first of the week's dinner parties in Edinburgh, hoping to impress guests James, Nutan, Sindiso and Anne with a night of fine dining.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night from the competition in Edinburgh, and cafe owner Nutan is hoping her happy-go-lucky attitude will have her laughing all the way to the bank.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week in Edinburgh is South-African born family man Sindiso, who hopes an evening of fun inspired by his homeland will win him the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Edinburgh security company manager Anne hopes her homely, relaxed night in will be enough to win the £1,000 prize - but rising tensions between the guests may scupper her chances.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final night in Edinburgh, and pilot James is hoping a touch of sophistication in his high-flying menu will see him land safely in first place. However, after the previous night's tension, his main concern is keeping any potential explosions contained. Guests Anne and Larah have a suspicion he could be serious competition. Will James manage to produce excellent food and keep the peace, leading him to victory?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples who are struggling to find suitable flats in Edinburgh because of the competitive market and their demanding search criteria. The first, Matt, a professional rugby player and his girlfriend Amy, have viewed more than 100 properties without success. The second pair, Sarah and Dom, are relocating from London with their one-year-old son and have a £600,000 budget, but too many special requirements for their dream home.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer use their property know-how to help a couple and two doctors who are looking for their dream homes on opposite sides of the Mersey. Gary Wakefield and his wife Nicky have an extensive wish list that includes three double bedrooms, a large garden and easy access to a top-rated school in the Wirral area, but do not have a budget to match, while graduate doctors Gemma Kealty and Susannah Brown are considering spending £200,000 on a flat share in Liverpool's Sefton Park.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet two couples looking for homes in the countryside of either Kent or neighbouring East Sussex. Army wife Charley Tomlinson, her husband Patrick and their four children are hoping to leave Sandhurst behind for a place to call their own, while Simon and Tina Haben want to trade in their one-bedroom flat in London for a more family friendly house within commuting distance of the capital.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to transform the fortunes of Sebastian's, a pizzeria in Burbank, Los Angeles, which is failing to attract customers, leaving the owner in debt and struggling to support his family. Gordon is horrified to discover pre-processed and frozen ingredients on the menu, but there seems to be little he can do to help when he is thrown out of the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzio's two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team's first patient is a West Highland terrier puppy that has a problem with its paws. Two new bionic feet later, and the poorly dog has a new lease of life. A young husky collie is also brought in after being hit by a car, only for the hip replacement operation to run into trouble, and a lazy dachshund requires double surgery and lots of physiotherapy.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan taking on guest captain Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan, and Bill Bailey in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: The mystery of red rain falling in Sri Lanka and India, how unusual weather is making Florida the sinkhole capital of the world, and strange lights in the sky that are baffling locals in a remote Norwegian town. Plus, ready-made snowballs in Alaska, giant spiderwebs covering trees in Pakistan, shard of ice sprouting from the ground in someone's back garden, and an underwater cloud in Mexico.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Diners include Sherry, a 65-year-old dominatrix looking for romance. She hopes chartered surveyor and t'ai chi enthusiast John might be the man for her. Meanwhile, Hannah, 40, is looking for a man who shares her love of adventure. Could 42-year-old Christmas tree farmer Rob be her Mr Right?.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by comedians Roisin Conaty and Kumail Nanjiani for a light-hearted review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The quintet offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Former pub landlady Janice Gibson wants to swap her Newcastle lifestyle for a new start in the Mar Menor area of southern Spain, so Laura Hamilton shows her a selection of properties starting from around £55,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Lesley Wall and Raspal Chima find a holiday home in Spain's province of Seville, with a view to spending half the year there when they eventually retire. With a budget of £150,000, the couple are amazed at how far their money will stretch.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Frankie and Gill Phibbs search for the home they have always dreamt of owning on Spain's Costa de la Luz. It has taken 20 years for the couple's plans to come to fruition and, having sold their family home in West Sussex and with a budget of £180,000, the pair are keen to seize the day and embark on their new life.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Blackpool couple Julie and Brent Birnie find a holiday home close to Florida's theme park capital, Orlando. They're amazed by what their budget of £70,000 can buy them, but it remains to be seen which property will suit them best.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps south London couple Simone and Carlton search for a new home on Barbados. They have a budget of £150,000 and hope they can achieve their 17-year dream of moving to the island after they enjoyed their first holiday there as a couple, and returned five years later to be married.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a couple searching for a house in East Sussex that is far away from neighbours without being remote, as well as a woman looking for a home in the Cotswolds.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Randy DeWitt, the CEO and co-founder of bar and grill chain Twin Peaks, goes undercover to find out whether the company's culture is keeping up with its rapid growth. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steven Newman, CEO of department store chain Loehmann's, views his company from a different perspective when he goes undercover as an aspiring entrepreneur visiting the shops after winning a reality TV contest - and learns first-hand that the employees are the foundation of the company.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jane Grote Abell, the Chairwoman of Donatos Pizza and daughter of the company's founder, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open her own restaurant. Her aim is to uncover where the company is going, what plans for the future should include and whether her father's values are still being upheld.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps newly retired Carlene Barnard find a holiday home in Torrevieja on the Costa Blanca that has plenty of room for her two children and their families.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows Fay Lewis five properties on the Costa del Sol, hoping that on a budget of £95,000, one of them will prove to be her dream home.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows software executive Andy and garden designer Nicki, who are planning to build a `floating' house on the Thames, which would be the first of its kind in the UK. Their architect has come up with an ambitious, experimental design that would see the whole property magically rise up with the flood waters. However, no one knows whether it will work, and the project soon becomes bogged down in the logistical challenges of bringing to fruition such a complex structure on a small island that is only accessible by a narrow footbridge.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides Joel Dommett, Jermaine Jenas, Adil Ray, Tamara Wall and team captain Rylan Clark-Neal on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team members must conquer physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael plans a romantic evening with Jay at an exclusive hotel, but Junior mistakenly cancels the reservation, forcing them to stay at home - where a disaster in the kitchen almost causes the house to burn down. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael's hands are chosen to appear in an advertising campaign, while Franklin feels threatened by Kady's growing friendship with Rachel and tries to drive a wedge between them. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother. Featuring games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat, as well as reactions to the latest eviction. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Stewart and Elmor visit Nottingham to chase almost £8,000 owed by a car dealership to a dissatisfied customer, while on the Isle of Wight, Brian and Del try to collect £3,700 of unpaid estate agency fees. The job begins peacefully, until one of the agents is physically assaulted by the debtor's wife. In Lancashire, Stewart and Iain struggle to identify the person who owes almost £2,000 after a failed compensation claim, while Del and Dael try to recover nearly £3,500 from a businessman in West London.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In Essex, Del and Dael try to collect nearly £3,000 owed by an Indian takeaway, but tempers flare when they threaten to seize kitchen equipment. Meanwhile, Paul and Steve evict a tenant who is £14,000 in rent arrears, and in Surrey, Del and Dael chase nearly £4,000 owed by a car dealer to a dissatisfied customer. Finally, in west London, two agents face one of their trickiest evictions to date, with their arrival at a young couple's flat coming as a shock.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Stewart and Elmor attempt to collect £5,000 owed by a debtor in north Wales, but the situation spirals out of control when a group of friends try to take on the agents. Meanwhile, Del and Dael head to south-east London to chase nearly £7,000 owed by a man to his ex-girlfriend, before visiting a woman who owes her solicitor almost £4,000 after a compensation claim went wrong. In Manchester, Stewart and Vic face a hostile reception at a family-run garage that owes £6,000 in professional fees.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady gives more lovelorn singletons a chance at romance. Manchester-based recruitment consultant Antoni must choose which of three self-assured ladies he would like to date, while Alice, a Celine Dion super-fan hopes her musical obsession will not stop her finding a girlfriend on her wavelength.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on claimants living by the sea. They include 50-year-old Gary, who recently moved to Jaywick in Essex to be with his partner Geoff in their dream coastal home, but now finds himself unemployed for the first time since he was 16. In the East Yorkshire town of Bridlington, homeless Caroline was taken in by good samaritan Heather. But now the flat is overcrowded and the friends desperately need rehousing.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Living the High Life.
programme.desc: The documentary about people fighting to make ends meet catches up with some of those featured in earlier editions. They include 54-year-old Londoner Kim, known as the `millionaire shoplifter', who is determined to leave her thieving days behind her. In Warrington, one-time Big Brother contestant Lisa's quest for fame is reinvigorated after a visit to a psychic. With a new agent and book deal on the horizon, she enjoys a VIP night out which gets the attention of the paparazzi. Meanwhile, after a cancer scare, Brighton woman Blossom is due for an exploratory operation - the results of which may be life-changing.(n)

programme.title: Mr & Mrs Smith
programme.desc: An outwardly bored suburban couple lead double lives as professional assassins, both unaware of their partner's secret. When they are hired to kill each other, the deadly situation puts some much-needed excitement back into their stale relationship. Comedy adventure, starring Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn and Adam Brody.(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Into the Blue stars Paul Walker and Jessica Alba as a pair of would-be fortune hunters who look for treasure at the bottom of the ocean after hurricane season. Their happy life in the Bahamas takes a turn when they get a visit from his old childhood friend (Scott Caan and his girlfriend (Ashley Scott). The foursome eventually discover a huge supply of seemingly abandoned cargo in a plane at the bottom of the ocean. They must battle both the bad guys who own the goods, as well as the shark that live in the water(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: The hilarious comedy duo, Golden Globe winner Jim Carrey and Golden Globe nominee Jeff Daniels, team up in this side-splitting comedy blockbuster about the cross-country adventures of two good-hearted but incredibly stupid friends who drive across the United States to return a client's briefcase! Brilliantly written and directed by the Award winning Farrelly Brothers who also brought you 'There's Something About Mary' and 'Shallow Hal'(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: Michael Clayton handles all of the dirty work for a major New York law firm, arranging top-flight legal services and skirting through loopholes for ethically questionable clients. But when a fellow fixer decides to turn on the very firm they were hired to clean up for, Clayton finds himself at the centre of a conspiratorial maelstrom(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: A driven police detective and his partner track down a major international drug dealer. They begin by following a couple they suspect because the duo lives far above their apparent means. They continue to follow a trail of clues that leads to a French criminal responsible for a large percentage of the drugs that come into New York City(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way: Rise to Power
programme.desc: Explosive action and a gritty atmosphere spark this crime drama, a prequel to 1993's "Carlito's Way." Jay Hernandez stars as Carlito Brigante (played by Al Pacino in the first film), a young hustler who rises through the ranks to become a drug czar in New York City's Spanish Harlem. But to sustain his power, Carlito must square off against corrupt cops and a smooth crime lord (Sean Combs). Luis Guzman(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: Programme details are currently unavailable(n)

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action film about a veteran police officer forced to break in a new young partner while trying to bust an international stolen-car ring. When the veteran cop is kidnapped by the crooks, it falls upon the hot-headed rookie to save the day, putting into practice everything the old pro has taught him(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Leonardo DiCaprio plays aCIA agent on the ground in Jordan, chasing a powerful terrorist leader(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: A lovelorn composer flies to a Hawaiian resort in hopes of forgetting the woman who broke his heart, only to discover she and her new boyfriend have just checked in(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: A renowned Harvard psychiatrist (with a concealed fear of heights) takes over as director of the PsychoNeurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous after the last administrator dies under suspicious circumstances(n)

programme.title: I Love You, Man
programme.desc: Comedy about an estate agent who realises just before his wedding that he doesn't have any real friends. Peter Klaven's world revolves around his real estate work and his fiancee. Friendless and in need of a best man, he embarks on a series of disastrous 'man dates' until by chance he meets amiable slacker Sydney Fife. Instantly bonding over their love of progressive rock band Rush, the two become inseparable, but their intense friendship soon puts the upcoming wedding in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Celestial intervention in the life of a bachelor sees him plunged into an alternative reality where he and his childhood sweetheart are happily married parents(n)

programme.title: Tetro
programme.desc: This involving drama stars Vincent Gallo as the title character, an ill-tempered, brooding poet living in Argentina, who is visited by his younger brother after a long estrangement during which the younger brother thought Tetro might be dead. The two discuss their troubled relationship with their composer father and attempt to find some common ground. Directed by Francis Ford Coppola(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Atrasado en camino a los tribunales, un abogado se pasa de un carril a otro. En otro carril, un padre cuyo derecho a ver a sus hijos depende de llegar a horario a los tribunales. Un accidente menor convertirá a estos dos extraños en bestias(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Vince Vaughn stars as Santa's loser older brother Fred, forced into helping out the elves after Saint Nick (Paul Giamatti) bails him out of trouble. Irreverent festive fun(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: Austin is back to stop Dr. Evil, who now has a assistance in the form of, 'Mini Me'. Hilarious British spy parody, also starring Will Ferrell and Heather Graham(n)

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: When a presidential candidate dies unexpectedly in the middle of the campaign, the Democratic party unexpectedly picks a Washington, D.C. alderman, Mays Gilliam, as his replacement(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of national pride and Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Jim Carrey does an uncanny and eerie impersonation of quirky actor-comedian Andy Kaufman in this revealing biography directed by Milos Forman. Carrey is a revelation as he slides into Kaufman's most famous and infamous creations: "Tenk you beddy much" Foreign Man, who evolved into Latka on "Taxi"; lounge-singer Tony Clifton; and Andy the Wrestler. Courtney Love, Danny DeVito(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three bright young students venture deep into the Nevada desert in search of a notorious hacker, and discover they have been drawn into an enigmatic plot with terrifying repercussions in this mind-bending sci-fi thriller. Intrigued by reports that a mysterious hacker named Nomad has breached MIT's advanced security system and exposed its flaws, freshmen Nic (Brenton Thwaites) and Jonah (Beau Knapp) hop in the car with Nick's girlfriend Hailey (Olivia Cooke), and attempt to track down the elusive computer genius. Eventually, the trail of clues leads the three students deep into the Nevada desert. There, they finally come face-to-face with Nomad just before everything goes black. Later, regaining consciousness in a high-security government facility, a confused Nic quickly finds that the worst is yet to come. Laurence Fishburne co-stars(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: This piercing drama follows a working-class American, a French journalist and a London schoolboy as their lives intersect when their collective grief leads them on a journey to discover the truth about the afterlife(n)

programme.desc: Adam Carolla goes on the trail of a contractor who was hired to create a half bath, laundry room and chicken coop, but fled the project, leaving a trail of excuses.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: Adam Carolla serves up a stern slice of justice for a contractor who took a couple's savings to build a balcony and a backyard oasis, but left the project not fit for purpose.(n)

programme.title: Killer Assistant
programme.desc: A high-profile magazine editor seemingly has the perfect life and career. Thriller, starring Arianne Zucker and Brando Eaton.(n)

programme.title: Family Secrets
programme.desc: A Californian woman inherits a ranch in the small town of Valentine in Nebraska and before she sells the property, she decides to spend the summer there and learn more about her family. Romantic drama, starring Michaela McManus, Diogo Morgado and Hunter Cross.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Lady in Waiting
programme.desc: A desperate woman is determined to rid herself of her domineering brother and gain control of the family business, so hatches a plan to shoot him and claim she thought he was a burglar. Although her plan seems to have worked, her new-found power goes to her head - and she also has to contend with Columbo, who is convinced of her guilt. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Leslie Nielsen and Susan Clark.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony's one-time Baltimore PD partner Danny Price is murdered in a manner that suggests the port-to-port killer has struck again. However, a key difference in the way the victim was bound suggests the crime was actually the work of a copycat, forcing the investigators to consider whether Price had any enemies.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New evidence reveals the serial killer has infiltrated the agency and is targeting a member of the NCIS team, prompting Gibbs to seek the guidance of his former mentor Mike Franks (Prison Break's Muse Watson). A lead from Barrett's squad reveals the CIA has also been tracking the murderer - and its findings suggest the culprit could be an even deadlier foe than anticipated.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team attend the funeral of a fallen colleague before resuming their hunt for the man they believe to be the port-to-port killer. Vance frantically researches the suspect's background to learn more about his motivations and discover who his next target could be - but one of the investigators follows a clue that leads to danger.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony tries to piece together the events that led to him lying wounded in a hospital bed, having been shot in the chest through his bulletproof vest. Under the guidance of therapist Dr Rachel Cranston, his memory begins to return and suspicion falls on his ex-lover EJ Barrett. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. McGee and Ziva follow a trail of blood that leads them to a mobile phone, while Abby discovers the victim had been trying to hack into Virginia's state website and Ducky's autopsy reveals that Hill had been injected with a sedative.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and the team are called in to look for the body of a murdered Muslim man that has gone missing from the morgue. As they try to establish a link between a top-secret residue found on the corpse and the victim's killers, their investigations uncover an experimental Navy tracking system and a plot to sell nuclear material to terrorists planning to make a bomb. Starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: In the wake of Baitfish's death, Pride suspects a mole is among the ranks. When the team members learn of a security breach at the New Orleans cargo ports, they fear this might be the very thing Baitfish taunted them about just prior to his untimely demise. Pride contemplates whether the threat could be something to do with the Broussard Syndicate, the crime family that has been one step ahead of him all year, so authorises his unit to cover every angle conceivable to ensure the city's safety.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: As an army convoy on a military exercise crosses a bridge, an unseen person detonates an IED, destroying the bridge and dropping a state-of-the-art guided missile into the river below. Below the waterline, divers wait and pick up their prize. After identifying those responsible, Pride puts himself on the line by going undercover to find out what they plan to do with their newly acquired weapon. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A youngster faces a heavy sentence after shooting dead the crooked businessman who murdered his mother - until his lawyer concocts a novel defence. Inspired by an academic study, she tries to pin blame for the crime on the widespread use of firearms in modern American society, arguing it has become a kind of disease. However, her stance provokes the anger of a local gun owners' association.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A girl is abducted on her way home from school, and inquiries reveal she has leukaemia, which had not been previously been diagnosed. As the team races to find her before she dies from her illness, Warner is sent to deliver the ransom to the kidnapper - but a botched meeting threatens to derail the case. Crime drama, starring Tamara Tunie and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team traces an abandoned baby back to a college student who claims she was raped and did not realise she was pregnant. However, her story is thrown into doubt when the team discovers this is not the first time she has been suspected of dumping a newborn.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The murder of a successful lawyer who moonlighted as a stripper leads Benson and Stabler to her secret lover - but the death of a second woman, who was seemingly killed in similar circumstances, raises the possibility that their suspect is being framed. Guest starring Rebecca De Mornay, with Mariska Hargitay and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

The Civil War is revisited in this taut episode of The Rifleman, which has a crippled Confederate soldier (Royal Dano) arriving at Lucas McCain's ranch at the same time as a visiting General Sheridan (Lawrence Dobkin). programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: Years before Kevin Costner danced with wolves, Robert Redford headed to the mountains to escape civilization in Sydney Pollack's wilderness western. Around 1850, ex-soldier Johnson (Redford) decides that he would rather live alone as a mountain man in Colorado than deal with society's constraints. After a series of setbacks, he meets grizzled mountain veteran Bear Claws (Will Geer), who teaches him how to survive. Jeremiah strives to live as peaceably as possible in the rugged environment, trading with the native Crow tribe, adopting a boy (Josh Albee) after his family is massacred, and even marrying the daughter (Delle Bolton) of a Flathead chief in order to avoid confrontation. He settles into a mountain home with his family, but the U.S. cavalry, complete with a puritanical Reverend, interrupt the idyll to compel Jeremiah to lead them over the mountains and through a Crow burial ground to rescue white settlers. After the Crow kill his family in retaliation, Jeremiah's frenzied moment of payback precipitates a long-running vendetta, turning him into a legendary Indian killer at the expense of his original ideals, on the way to a final moment of grace. Spectacularly shot on location in Utah, the film captures both the appeal and the challenge of the landscape that Jeremiah chooses over civilization. With an unglamorous performance by Redford and a story that questioned white colonialism while mythologizing the man of nature, Jeremiah Johnson appealed to its 1972 audience and became one of the biggest hits of the year. Wavering between heroicizing Jeremiah for surviving and damning him for killing, Jeremiah Johnson took its place among the Vietnam-era cycle of critical westerns, like Arthur Penn's Little Big Man (1970) and Robert Altman's McCabe and Mrs. Miller (1971), that condemned civilization for corrupting the wilderness and preventing individuals from going pacifistically native(n)

programme.desc: TEOTWAWKI. Still finding their place, Alicia and Nick fall in with new crowds; while Madison discovers Otto's past mimics that of her own(n)

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.sub-title: Burning in Water, Drowning in Flame
programme.desc: Burning in Water, Drowning in Flame. A new threat reveals itself to Madison and Troy as they search for answers. Elsewhere, Alicia must reconcile with her past decisions(n)

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: The Unveiling/Children of Wrath. A new arrival sows a divide within the ranch. Meanwhile, Alicia forms a new relationship in hopes of maintaining peace. Then, Madison must negotiate the terms of an agreement in the midst of ranch-wide turmoil(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: When a spaceship suffers mechanical failure and is forced to land on an alien world, its passengers' attempts to escape are hindered by ravenous nocturnal monsters. With the planet basking in sunlight, the group feel safe in the knowledge that the creatures can only survive in the dark. But a rare total eclipse is imminent, and so a battle between man and beast begins(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: Powerful crime drama about a petty criminal who is released after five years in prison when his corrupt lawyer exploits a legal technicality. Carlito is determined to go straight, but he agrees to take part in a lucrative shady business deal at his attorney's instigation - figuring to discharge the debt of gratitude he owes. Despite his intentions, he finds himself relentlessly drawn back into the world he sought to escape(n)

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Trippy adaptation of the cult sci-fi adventure follows an alien and an earthling on a cosmic joyride through space(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: When business executive Lee Cullen uncovers a plot to deliver a super-weapon into enemy hands, she is assigned to the witness protection programme under US Marshal John 'Eraser' Kruger. But just who is hunting Lee down?(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: Rollicking and raucous buddy bash stars Paul Rudd and Seann William Scott as two hard-partying pals who are given community service which entails looking after two troubled youngsters, one a geeky teen outcast and the other a potty-mouthed tough. Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Bobb'e J. Thompson stand out as the kids. Jane Lynch, Elizabeth Banks, Ken Marino. Directed by David Wain, who cowrote the script with Rudd, Marino (who plays Jim Stansel), Tim Dowling and W. Blake Herron(n)

programme.title: Zoolander

But fashion designer Will Ferrell has plans for the ex-model - he's going to turn him into an international assassin!(n)

programme.title: MI-5

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Tense thriller. Car thief Memphis Raines is forced to steal 50 luxury vehicles in one night in order to save the life of his brother, who has fallen foul of a dangerous crime lord. Once the most successful car thief in California, Raines must reassemble his old gang to fulfil the almost impossible mission. His task is further hampered by a rival band of thieves and the local police(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: The film revolves around virologist Robert Neville, who is immune to a man-made virus that was created to cure cancer but has now killed 90% of the human population. He lives in New York and is working on the cure for the virus while defending himself against mutants that have been created by the virus(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The story revolves around Peter Parker, a disguised super hero who has to stop Otto Octavius, an evil scientist, who is on a mission to avenge his wife's death(n)

programme.title: Constantine

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Vince Vaughn stars as Santa's loser older brother Fred, forced into helping out the elves after Saint Nick (Paul Giamatti) bails him out of trouble. Irreverent festive fun(n)

programme.title: Tron

He and his henchman, the electronic warrior Tron, face many trials and finally have to battle for their lives with the computer itself(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: A rock-and-roll detective who floats through the clubs of Hollywood, picking up women and clients, stumbles into a case involving the death of a heavy metal singer(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Fast-paced action comedy in which a dowdy romantic-adventure writer is hurled into a real-life adventure in the Colombian jungle in order to save her sister, who will be killed if a treasure map is not delivered to her captors. She is helped out by a brash mercenary, and together they search for the priceless gem located in the map. A non-stop mix of thrills, laughter and romance with energetic performances all round(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: A female political consultant is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival, who is working on the opponent's campaign and is looking for every opportunity to antagonize her(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: A divorced boat builder discovers that his young son's stepdad is masking an evil side, forcing him to desperately try to protect his ex-wife and son from the new man in their lives(n)

programme.title: Marauders

programme.desc: John Cena stars in this action adventure from Die Hard 2 director Renny Harlin. New Orleans cop Danny Fisher is given plenty of time to rue ever crossing paths with Miles Jackson, who makes his living supplying weapons to terrorists. A year earlier, a sting operation to capture Jackson resulted in the death of his girlfriend - and a vow of revenge from the criminal. Now, Jackson has escaped prison and is intent on making good his threat. He starts by blowing up Fisher's house and car, before explaining that he has kidnapped the detective's girlfriend, Molly. If Fisher wants to see Molly again, he must first complete a dozen fiendish tasks, most of which are designed to see Fisher blown to bits. And so begins a frantic, destructive rush around The Big Easy..(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: The Gathering Storm. Documentary telling the full story of World War II with the aid of rare and unseen archive footage, recently released official documents, modern colourisation techniques, state-of-the-art satellite-delivered terrain mapping and graphics. In the run-up to September 1939, political and economic chaos in the aftermath of World War I allowed Hitler in Germany, Mussolini in Italy and ultra-nationalists in imperial Japan to seize absolute power. When Britain, France and the United States failed to confront initial acts of aggression, contempt for their weakness prompted Germany and Italy to intervene in the civil war in Spain and Hitler to make a series of land grabs which brought Europe to the brink of war. Ep. 1 (Followed by News)(n)

programme.desc: Britain at Bay. After the retreat from Dunkirk, Churchill rallied Britain in its darkest hour. Hitler was only just across the channel, but he reckoned without our supreme strategist, the might of the navy and the manoeuvrability of the air force. Crucially, Britain now had radar and the Enigma code had been broken. After the Battle of Britain, Churchill commenced the fight back(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Walk on the Wild Side. The zoo's conservation work with American bison involves an embryo transfer program between two herds thousands of miles apart. Meanwhile, a diamondback rattlesnake fighting an infection requires oral medication; and the Ambassador Center staff trains two cheetahs to stroll comfortably among humans on the grounds(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Love Shack. An elaborate hut is built for a pair of kiwis to breed; a king cobra arrives at the zoo, but it's not easy training it to move from the exhibit to a holding pen(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Back to Africa. A journey to eastern Africa is undertaken to return thousands of toads to the wild that were rescued from extinction. Also: A giraffe tries out a new piece of equipment; the avian department works to save the lives of millions of birds(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Higher Purpose. Two tiger cubs that are growing fast get ready to move to the adult enclosure; a silverback gorilla receives treatment for glaucoma; a zookeeper plays matchmaker for a pair of birds(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Moving Day. A male sea lion is in a rut, so the staff must move the younger ones before he becomes territorial; a flamingo has a broken ankle; feeding a rock python presents a challenge(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is at the RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show, where he is joined by Neil Rankin and Andi Oliver, who cook in the show's specially designed edible garden.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge gives advice on making a casual weekday supper for sharing around the kitchen table with friends or family. She prepares a Mediterranean platter of houmous, breadsticks, roasted vegetables and tomato and mozzarella salad, as well as lamb dhansak, cottage pie topped with dauphinoise potatoes, and a pasta dish that takes just 15 minutes. She also shows to make elderflower cordial and a crunchy apple crumble.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further live coverage of day six at the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles, which today includes Ernests Gulbis v Novak Djokovic, Mischa Zverev v Roger Federer, and Angelique Kerber v Shelby Rogers. There was no doubt as to the main headline on day six last year, which saw Djokovic crash out in a thrilling four-set encounter on Court One, losing 6-7, 1-6, 6-3, 6-7 to America's Sam Querrey, and he will hope to avoid a similar fate today against Gulbis, who recorded a surprise straight-sets victory over Juan Martin del Potro in the previous round.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Ed Baines and Paul Rankin team up to battle fellow chefs Tony Singh and Cyrus Todiwala, Jean-Christophe Novelli joins forces with TV cook Jo Pratt and former Great British Bake Off finalist Richard Burr works together with 2013 finalist Frances Quinn, as Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a `food and drink' themed edition of the star-studded general knowledge quiz.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: The choral music contest reaches its fourth heat, as another six diverse groups seek to demonstrate their vocal skills. This time, the ensembles are a cappella group The Bristol Suspensions, Liverpool pop choir Over the Water, all-female country group The Savannahs, show choir Perfect 6th, Portsmouth University Gospel Choir and musical theatre performers Vocal-i-sing. Each group is given a chance to display their speciality with a `showstopper' performance, before battling it out with their rivals in a themed `riff-off'. Guest judge Seal joins Gareth Malone and Kelis on the panel.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ethan discovers Scott's brother Mickey is in a secret relationship with Jez, and he seeks to befriend the lad and turn him against his sibling. However, when Mickey proves to be too terrified to help, Ethan turns to blackmail instead, earning disapproval from both Jez and Alicia. Meanwhile, Connie pulls rank on Sam when he asks for time off to take Grace to a physiotherapy session, and later, Sam spots a chance to undermine Connie while treating a bride who mysteriously collapsed at the altar.(n)

programme.title: Little Fockers
programme.desc: Nurse Greg is now the proud father of twins, but has yet to earn the respect of his wife's stern father after 10 years of marriage. The couple invite both sides of their extended family to the kids' birthday party, where Greg makes a desperate effort to finally prove his worth to his father-in-law. Comedy sequel, with Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson and Dustin Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Tropic Thunder
programme.desc: A director's epic Vietnam movie is behind schedule and over budget. Taking the advice of the grizzled war veteran on whose life the film is based, he drops the actors into a jungle with the intention of filming them fighting guerrilla-style - but the cast is unaware the surrounding warfare is genuine. Comedy, directed by and starring Ben Stiller, with Jack Black, Steve Coogan and, in an Oscar-nominated role, Robert Downey Jr.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Samanthi Flanagan present discussion of transgender issues and organ donation, while Jerry Springer considers possible future presidential candidates in the US.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Lincoln, antiques experts Charlie Ross and Richard Madley assist two teams comprising twin sisters and best friends competing to buy three items in the hope of making the most profit at auction. Presenter Eric Knowles keeps his eye on proceedings and also enjoys an appointment with royalty.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents continued coverage from The Olympic Stadium in London, where the ninth meeting of the Diamond League campaign takes place. Mo Farah is expected to return to the scene of arguably his most notable triumph and compete at this year's games, alongside fellow British stars such as Katarina Johnson-Thompson, Laura Muir, Greg Rutherford, and six-time Paralympic champion David Weir, who is scheduled to compete in the final race of his illustrious career.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to north Wales to help a recently retired couple find a rural retreat on a budget of £400,000. While in the region, the presenter also catches up with a pair who longed to lead a self-sufficient lifestyle and found their ideal home three years earlier.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Mont St Michel in France to meet modern-day pilgrims and discover the history of the monastery. Josie D'Arby explores a link with a similar site in Cornwall.(n)

programme.title: How to Holiday Better
programme.desc: Cherry Healey and Ade Adepitan find the perfect holiday for members of the public. Plus, Richard Madeley and Steph McGovern present guides to Venice and Oman.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a groundbreaking project in Northamptonshire to incorporate wildlife conservation into a retail park. John Craven visits a micro-tannery and goes in search of an elusive butterfly, Adam Henson finds out about an insect farm in Cumbria, and Tom Heap reports on homelessness in rural areas.(n)

programme.title: Fake or Fortune
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and art expert Philip Mould visit a B&B in Aberdeenshire to pick up where the owner's late husband left off in proving that a painting is the work of 19th-century French artist Paul Delaroche. A visit to the British museum raises evidence that this could be a lost treasure once belonging to France's last king and queen, and they head for Normandy to inspect a stained glass window in the image of a lost Delaroche painting - but they also begin to suspect it is a copy, rather than the original.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: The French Royalists plan an invasion, which Caroline hopes will lead to Dwight's release. However, Ross is convinced this will only make matters worse, and recruits a band of allies, including Tholly, Zacky, Drake and Henshawe, to help him free Dwight from prison. George schemes to further his political ambitions, and when he learns of Ross' plan, he uses it as a means to discredit his rival, accusing him of recklessness - a charge that may prove true when the rescue mission proves to have fatal consequences.(n)

programme.title: Sue Barker: Our Wimbledon
programme.desc: The presenter travels the globe meeting Wimbledon greats such as Andy Murray, Roger Federer, Pete Sampras, Billie Jean King and Martina Navratilova.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Young landlords Dan and Jamie are given a reality check in Co Durham when they move into their tenant Michael's home. At first, they are blase about the jobs that need doing, but when they come face to face with Michael everything is thrown into question. In Leeds, old feelings and difficult memories are raked up for millionaire Prab when he is taken back to his own impoverished childhood.(n)

programme.title: Lucky Partners
programme.desc: A woman is wished good luck by a neighbour, and goes on to have a lucky day. Deciding he is a source of good fortune, she persuades him to share a sweepstake ticket with her. However, her fiance is not happy when their horse wins and they plan to go on holiday with the money. Romantic comedy, starring Ginger Rogers, Ronald Colman and Jack Carson.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Profile of Oscar-winning actor John Mills, featuring clips from TV appearances he made during his seven-decade career, and capturing the milestones and highlights of his fame. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Scott of the Antarctic
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following explorer Robert Falcon Scott's failed expedition to be the first to reach the South Pole. The extreme conditions, poor decision-making and the pressure of the race to make it to the Pole before their Norwegian rivals proved too much for the British team, resulting in tragedy in 1912. Starring John Mills, Derek Bond, James Robertson Justice, Kenneth More and John Gregson.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Athletissima. Gabby Logan introduces action from the eighth meeting of the season, which took place at Stade Olympique de la Pontaise in Lausanne, Switzerland.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents from the All England Club, where the sixth day's play gets under way with the latest men's and ladies' singles third-round matches.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to pick up bargains in London's Portobello Road under the expert guidance of Jonathan Pratt and Kate Bliss, with Tim Wonnacott overseeing proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents further live coverage of the Grand Slam tournament, featuring matches in the bottom half of the men's draw and top half of the ladies' draw. Some of the more notable matches scheduled for today include Anett Kontaveit v Caroline Wozniacki, Agnieszka Radwanska v Timea Bacsinszky, and Milos Raonic v Albert Ramos Vinolas, and Raonic in particular will be looking to replicate his form on the corresponding day of last year's tournament, when he recorded a victory in three straight sets. With Serena Williams absent from this year's tournament the ladies' draw appears to be wide open this year, and the likes of Wozniacki and Radwanska, both of whom have consistently been ranked among the top 10 players in the world, will be looking to claim their first Grand Slam singles title.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the sixth day's play at SW19, where the line-up for the last 16 was set to be decided. The middle Saturday is always a special occasion at SW19 and the crowd on Centre Court last year were treated to the sight of Milos Raonic and Andy Murray progressing to the fourth round with respective victories over Jack Sock and John Millman, while Novak Djokovic was dumped out of the tournament on Court One against Sam Querrey.(n)

programme.title: Museum of the Year
programme.desc: Tristram Hunt, the newly appointed director of the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, presents coverage of Art Fund's 2017 Museum of the Year ceremony. This year, the finalists are London's Tate Modern and John Soane Museum, the Newmarket Heritage Centre for Horseracing and Sporting Art, Birmingham's Lapworth Museum of Geology, and the Hepworth art gallery in Wakefield. In 2016, the V&A claimed the coveted award, and here, Tristram seeks tips and advice on maintaining its lofty reputation from those responsible for running the museums up for recognition this year.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Hal Cruttenden, Ed Gamble and Zoe Lyons. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the notoriously obscure quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and Greg Davies join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous marriage and mating matters.(n)

programme.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
programme.desc: Scientists detect a mysterious black monolith on the moon is transmitting a signal to Jupiter. A spacecraft is sent on a mission to investigate the origins of the strange object, but as they near their destination, the astronauts realise the computer controlling the ship is turning against them. Stanley Kubrick's sci-fi epic, with Keir Dullea, William Sylvester, Gary Lockwood and Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: West
programme.desc: An East German woman and her young son emigrate to West Germany in the late 1970s to start a new life. They find themselves at a refugee transit camp in West Berlin, where they are interrogated by officials from an intelligence agency, who demand information about the mother's dead boyfriend, who is suspected of being a spy. Drama, starring Jordis Triebel and Tristan Gobel. In German.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Mona Lisa
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon explores major new findings about Leonardo da Vinci's masterpiece, the Mona Lisa, as centuries-old documents are decoded and the latest optical, forensic, and historical tools and techniques are employed to reveal its secrets. Questions and mysteries surrounding the famous portrait - and the artist himself - are unravelled as art historians, authenticators, forensic specialists and academics attempt to get to the truth.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter U, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Presenter Helen Skelton and expert garden designer Danny Clarke bring unloved gardens back to life in a single day using clever design, imaginative ideas and recycling or re-use of existing plants and materials.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison meets a family making natural cordials and presses using their own elderflowers, before visiting Worcester Cathedral to catch a glimpse of its lesser horseshoe bats, thought to be the only urban population in the country. Adam Henson heads to the Peak District and explains why he has decided to send his beef cattle to an animal sanctuary in Norfolk rather than the slaughterhouse.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: Nigel's tour of the flavours of Britain takes him from a classic Lancashire hotpot to three melt-in-the-mouth one-pot dishes with origins from around the world. He meets Yasmin, whose fesenjoon takes her back to her childhood in Iran, gets a lesson in Brazil's national dish feijoada from brothers Andre and Anderson, and discovers the delicate flavours of a traditional Bangladeshi korma as he joins Enam and his family to celebrate Eid. Inspired by their dishes, Nigel creates a luxurious bean hotpot bejewelled with beetroot and carrot.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nation's love affair with beer and cider, revealing how at one time it was safer to drink ale than water. The duo are also given a chance to gain hands-on brewing experience at a cider festival.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage from The Olympic Stadium in London, where the ninth meeting of the Diamond League campaign takes place. Coverage continues on BBC One.(n)

programme.title: The Great Caruso
programme.desc: Biopic of the acclaimed Italian operatic tenor Enrico Caruso, charting his progress from humble beginnings as a choirboy in Naples, to his difficult rise to fame in America, as he struggles to find acceptance before ultimately being recognised as one of the world's greatest singers. Starring Mario Lanza, Ann Blyth, Dorothy Kirsten and Jarmila Novotna.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Killer Whales: Beneath the Surface - Natural World.
programme.desc: A look at research into the lives of the marine mammals, which were long regarded as fearsome predators until the first one was brought into captivity for study in 1964, revealing facts about their profound intelligence, social interactions and parental instincts. The programme illustrates how contemporary studies continue to unearth revelations about the whales' behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms an old sofa, a gatepost and a canoe from a tip in Surrey, before selling them to try and make a profit for the people dumping them.(n)

programme.title: Rowing World Cup
programme.desc: Action from the third and final meeting of the season, which took place in Lucerne, Switzerland, and saw the British team looking to build on their success at round two in Poland. Matthew Pinsent presents, with analysis from Helen Glover, and commentary by James Cracknell and Gary Herbert.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin, Mark Stacey and Philip Serrell visit Greater Manchester, where items of interest include a ceramic tile, etchings by artist John Buckland-Wright and a gold necklace. Paul also interviews the great-granddaughter of suffragette Emmeline Pankhurst.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.sub-title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway: The Final Countdown.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Engineers must construct and fit out a new station at Paddington and erect a great glass canopy to soar above the structure, while workers at Tottenham Court Road are building underground platforms and concourses the size of an aircraft carrier in the heart of the world's busiest shopping district. In Derby, a father and son team race to construct 66 trains to ferry passengers across the 30 miles of Crossrail line.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sarah Willingham examine the profit-making potential of more business plans, including an innovative form of nail gel, a toilet-flushing gadget for children, and a parking app from an entrepreneur whose company valuation stuns the panel. Hosted by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A Norwegian sheep farmer is finding the long hours and hard work of his demanding life are taking their toll. He trades places with a taxi driver from Devon who has dreams of running a farm, but fears the financial instability of giving up his job to pursue this goal. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Foxcatcher
programme.desc: Premiere. A reclusive, eccentric millionaire persuades an Olympic gold-medal-winning wrestler to join his personal team. Initially flattered by the attention lavished upon him by his wealthy new friend, the fighter flourishes - but tension soon grows between them when his brother is employed as a coach, a situation that leads to tragedy. Fact-based drama, starring Steve Carell, Channing Tatum and Mark Ruffalo.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: In a bid to get back everything he has lost, his marriage, his livelihood and self-worth, Vincent concocts a spectacular plot to return to his rightful place, with the help of local gangster, Ronnie Farrell. But before that, he has to pay off his massive tax bill. Meanwhile, when Carol makes a simple mistake, Fitzpatrick and Lavender must help save the day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Goob
programme.desc: A teenager spends every summer helping out in his mother's cafe and working on the harvest in the nearby pumpkin fields. The latest harvest season proves a very different one, as tension brews with his mother's new boyfriend and a flirtatious relationship with a foreign worker in the fields makes him consider a different future. Drama, starring Liam Walpole and Marama Corlett.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby sails along the coast of East Anglia, exploring how Britain's view of the sea has changed over the past 200 years. The coast and the beach became a playground for the nation, inspiring artists, transforming coastal architecture and creating a seaside culture that remains uniquely British. Setting out from Gorleston-on-Sea, he travels down the Suffolk and Essex coasts and into the Thames, until he reaches Greenwich. Along the way he discovers works of art that reflect Britain's evolving relationship with the sea, meets a sand sculptor and visits the Queen's House in Greenwich, built in 1616 as a waterside retreat for Queen Anne and now home to Britain's greatest collection of maritime artefacts. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: How the growth of phytoplankton along the coastal waters of Alaska and British Columbia attracts a vast array of marine life to feast on billions of herring. Footage includes humpback whales migrating from Hawaii as well as Steller sea lions, dolphins and killer whales that make the long and arduous journey toward the abundant fish, risking malnutrition and attacks from predators along the way. Narrated by David Attenborough. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mea Culpa
programme.desc: Premiere. A police officer leaves the force in disgrace after drunkenly causing an accident that killed three people. Years later, his son witnesses a crime and is targeted by gangsters. The boy's father turns to his old partner for help, and together they fight to bring down the crime syndicate. Crime thriller, starring Vincent Lindon and Gilles Lellouche. In French.(n)

programme.title: Titanic's Tragic Twin: The Britannic Disaster
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Andy Torbet try to piece together the events of November 21, 1916, when the Britannic, sister ship to the Titanic, sank in just 55 minutes. Kate speaks to some of the survivors' descendants, including those of Violet Jessops, who survived both Titanic and Britannic, and look-out Archie Jewell, who survived when those around him lost their lives.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long present the February 23 show, featuring Hot Chocolate, Rockwell, Nik Kershaw, Carmel and Howard Jones.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jenson introduce performances by Matt Bianco, Van Halen, Alexei Sayle, Break Machine, Wang Chung, Slade, Nena and Julia & Company. First shown March 1, 1984.(n)

programme.title: Synth Britannia at the BBC
programme.desc: A showcase of 1970s and 80s synth music taken from the BBC archives. Popular acts in the genre include Roxy Music, New Order, Ultravox, Soft Cell, OMD, Yazoo and Depeche Mode.(n)

programme.title: Synth Britannia
programme.desc: An examination of the musical backdrop of the 1980s when synthpop was all the rage, having been popularised by bands including Depeche Mode, Ultravox and Soft Cell. The documentary also studies how this genre influenced the future of electronic music and groups such as Pet Shop Boys and New Order. Featuring interviews with Bernard Sumner, Gary Numan and Neil Tennant.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Ballet: Woolf Works
programme.desc: A performance from the Royal Opera House of Wayne McGregor's ballet inspired by the works of Virginia Woolf. The production's three acts are each themed around one of Woolf's novels - Mrs Dalloway, Orlando and The Waves - while also drawing on her letters, essays and diaries. Introduced by Darcey Bussell and Clemency Burton-Hill.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Volcanoes have long helped shape the Earth, but what is less well known is that there are volcanoes on other planets and moons that are even more extraordinary than those on our own home planet. Cameras follow a team of volcanologists in Iceland as they draw parallels with the volcanoes on Earth and those elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Maggie Aderin-Pocock and Chris Lintott report on the presence of trans-Neptunian objects, a large number of minor planets on the edge of the solar system, many with moons of their own and unusual orbits. Plus, Marcus du Sautoy reveals how the mathematical study of these objects may increase our understanding of how the solar system was created.(n)

programme.title: Destination Titan
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of a British team involved in preparing the European Space Agency's Huygens probe for its two-billion-mile journey to Saturn's largest moon, a voyage that took seven years. The film explores the sacrifices involved in the project, and the scientists talk about their hopes for the probe, and thoughts on its successful landing in 2005.(n)

programme.title: The Search for Life: The Drake Equation
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell visits scientists around the world who have researched different aspects of Dr Frank Drake's equation. Formulated in the 1960s, it was intended to determine where to point one of the radio telescopes at the National Radio Astronomy Observatory in Virginia in a bid to detect extraterrestrial life. Despite the calculation of a possible 50,000 civilisations being able to communicate across the galaxy, no signals were received - but the project focused on other questions about the universe.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.sub-title: Live AFL: Hawthorn v GWS Giants.
programme.desc: Hawthorn and GWS Giants go head-to-head in round 16 of the Australian Football League. The Giants are one of the highest scoring teams in 2017, averaging 101 points per game.(n)

programme.title: America's Cup
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at how Oracle Team USA mounted a dramatic comeback from 8-1 down to remarkably defeat New Zealand 9-8 at the 34th America's Cup in 2013.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.sub-title: Live AFL: St Kilda v Richmond.
programme.desc: St Kilda and Richmond clash in round 16 of the Australian Football League at the Etihad Stadium. St Kilda are aiming for four consecutive wins for the first time since 2011.(n)

programme.title: Classic MOTD - Thrillers
programme.desc: We delve into the Match of the Day archives to revisit highlights of the 1980/81 First Division clash at Ayresome Park.(n)

programme.title: Classic MOTD - Thrillers
programme.desc: We delve into the Match of the Day archives to revisit highlights of the 1980/81 Second Division clash at Stamford Bridge.(n)

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: On this week's show, BMXer Kyle Baldock previews this summer's X Games, MMA star Gunnar Nelson reveals his top tips and the Cliff Diving World Series gets underway in Ireland.(n)

programme.title: AFL
programme.desc: Hawthorn and GWS Giants go head-to-head in round 16 of the Australian Football League. The Giants are one of the highest scoring teams in 2017, averaging 101 points per game.(n)

programme.title: NBA Reload
programme.desc: BT Sport rounds up the best NBA action from the past week, including exclusive interviews and so much more.(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30 Shorts
programme.desc: This 30 for 30 Shorts documentary delves into perhaps one of the most important, but least known, feats of Muhammad Ali's remarkable life, his intervention in Iraq in 1990.(n)

programme.title: ESPN Classic Boxing
programme.desc: We rewind the clock to the heavyweight clash between Australian Joe Bugner and home-favourite Frank Bruno at White Hart Lane in 1987.(n)

programme.title: ESPN Classic Boxing
programme.sub-title: Classic Boxing: Benn v Eubank I.
programme.desc: We revisit the gripping 1990 bout between Nigel Benn and Chris Eubank at the National Exhibition Centre, regarded by many as one of the greatest fights of all time.(n)

programme.title: No Filter Boxing
programme.desc: BT Sport's countdown show follows boxers as they prepare for Saturday's BT Sport Fight Night at the Copper Box in London.(n)

programme.title: BT Sport Fight Night Live

Having become a media celebrity as a result of her pageant heroics, Gracie now spends more time at the salon than the shooting range, as she works the talk show circuit to promote her book. When her pageant friends, winner Cheryl and emcee Stan, are kidnapped in Las Vegas, Gracie jumps back into action to save them, putting herself at loggerheads with the FBI top brass, who don't want to risk losing their prized mascot and who fear she might not be up to the job anymore(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 412. Mark and Lori offer an entrepreneur an investment of $1 million; an engineer runs into difficulty discussing finances; and the makers of a peanut butter from Season 3 offer an update on their business. Also: Friends share their idea for a cabinet that combines beer and video games; an idea for peel-off face paint is pitched; and a mom talks up the benefits of her hair-care products for kids(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 528. Three men from Jackson, N.J., claim to have come up with a product that will revolutionize the painting industry; two moms from Austin try to win a deal for their portable mat that fits into an ultracompact pouch; and a pair of Harvard Business School grads want the Sharks to bite on a way to make healthy meals easier. Also: whole-grain mixes for flapjacks and waffles; an update on Grace and Lace, which Barbara invested in during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 601. A couple from Fort Worth hope to interest the Sharks in their unique way to swaddle a baby. Other pitches include: a nail salon just for men; a better version of the athletic sock; and a free charging station for mobile phones. Also: Mark and Barbara take entrepreneurs to see their products on display at Target stores(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 706. A dad pitches his potty-training device; and three friends from Los Angeles hope to start a tasty trend with their baked-to-order sweets. Also: an update on an inspirational toy business invested in by Mark Cuban during Season 6(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 705. The Sharks bid over the asking price for one product; another pitch elicits a negative response; and two different entrepreneurs try to attract bids for a full-length mirror designed to build self-esteem and redefined drones. Also: Parents from Salem, Mass., try to manage excess Halloween candy; a duo from Pacific Palisades, Cal., make the panel swoon with their premium beef jerky; and Lori Grenier offers an update on her investment in the New York City-based Bantam Bagels(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 616. A man from Davenport, Fla., seeks an investment in his grass delivery service for pet owners. Also: a device to eliminate clogged sinks; a worry-free way to share lip balm without sharing germs; a climate-control system for beds; and an update on Barbara Corcoran's investment in Tom+Chee from Season 4(n)
