programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team works with Abigail Borin of the Coast Guard Investigative Service after a highly suspicious explosion and fire on board an oil rig kills a US marine corps reservist. Abby detects malware in the platform's computer systems, while Ducky finds traces on the victim's body that lead to a lawyer who works for the oil company. Back in the office, a prankster is bringing some light relief and although the likeliest suspect is Tony, he denies any involvement. Crime drama, guest starring Diane Neal.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is forced to take a step back from work when his increasingly frail father Jackson begs him to help track down an old friend from the Second World War who does not have long left to live. Meanwhile, the rest of the team investigate the death of a marine sergeant who appears to have been caught in the crossfire during a bungled robbery, but Tony and Tim find evidence the victim may have been targeted. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Jody Ray is killed by a hit-and-run driver and evidence points to staff sergeant Justin Dunne, whose guilt seems certain when DiNozzo and McGee find him washing a bloodstained knife when they go to arrest him. However, Dunne tells his lawyer Carrie Clark he was miles away in Falls Church at the time - stabbing bookmaker Donny Sullivan to death. Unable to reveal the truth to the NCIS team, Clark decides to check out the alibi herself. Crime drama, guest starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield (A Town Called Eureka).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An internal security breach forces NCIS to go into lockdown when a covert listening device is found in a pen belonging to Secretary of the Navy Sarah Porter. DiNozzo discovers that National Security Agency analyst Ellie Bishop wrote a report two years previously predicting the possibility of such an occurrence and she is brought in to assist with the investigation and track down the culprit. Guest starring Leslie Hope and Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate when marine corporal Flegman is found shot to death, and a phone leads them to a hotel room where Gibbs awkwardly stumbles upon his ex-wife Diane Sterling and her FBI agent ex-husband TC Fornell. She had been attempting to call her boyfriend Eddie to break up with him, but somehow Flegman had taken possession of his phone. The team tracks down Eddie's car and discovers a clown nose along with traces of blood and he quickly becomes the prime suspect.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb plot is uncovered following a death at a Quantico reunion, and tensions in the squad room cause trouble for Torres and Quinn as they settle into their new jobs.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine sergeant falls to her death from a building, and when Gibbs and his team examine the circumstances, the woman's doctor urges him to consider this a murder investigation.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In a bid to get his old team-mates back together, Patrick decides to pit them against his new work colleagues in a challenge to solve the murder of a fitness trainer. Meanwhile, Lisbon visits Red John's wife Sally at her home, only to discover she has committed suicide. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: One of Patrick's former clients gets in touch with him when her nine-year-old son is kidnapped and demands that he use his psychic powers to help find the child, despite Lisbon's scepticism. The investigation leads to relatives of the boy, but things get complicated when the main suspect is killed.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and the team are assigned to protect the mayor during a rally about immigration rights. While searching the area, they find the body of a photographer who has been robbed and murdered. The investigation initially seems to point to a homeless man, but when the memory card in the victim's camera is found to have a close-up picture of the killer on it, the team races to prevent an imminent murder.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a girl on an island and discovers the victim had been conducting inquiries into her father's murder. Jane gathers the town residents for a meeting and tells them he knows the killer is among them, but his suspicions are badly received by the locals. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.sub-title: Where in the World Is Carmine O'Brien?.
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a police chief, and Lisbon is in for a surprise when her bounty hunter brother Tommy and his daughter turn up unexpectedly. The agent is initially reluctant to have her relatives around, but when Tommy and the CBI's investigations cross paths, the team must plan a whole new strategy to catch the killer.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan decides to alleviate the stresses of his hectic family life by buying a hot tub. However, he fails to count on his new purchase having an evil agenda of its own. Animated comedy, with the voice of show creator Seth MacFarlane, and guest star Cee-Lo Green.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Crossover episode in which characters from Family Guy and The Cleveland Show end up meeting the Smiths when a storm hits the towns of Quahog, Stoolbend and Langley Falls.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Hayley experiences the hardships of pregnancy when Roger agrees to `give birth' to Jeff to make him human again. Meanwhile, Snot is offended when Steve signs him up for a makeover.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter learns about phone apps and his newly acquired enthusiasm soon sees his phone overloaded. He buys a new mobile with greater memory and gives his old one to Chris, which sets in motion a series of horrible events leading to his son being branded a sex offender and sent on a rehab course.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Extended episode in which Brian and Stewie travel to the North Pole to teach Father Christmas a lesson after being snubbed by a mall-based Santa. However, on finding him incapacitated, the pair decide to step into his sleigh and deliver the gifts in his place - but their efforts fall desperately short of the mark.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smith family stars in a spoof of classic James Bond films. Stan sets out to stop producer Tearjerker (played by Roger), who has devised a diabolical scheme to make movies so depressing that anyone who watches them will ultimately die of despair.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine feels threatened when her mother-in-law seeks Stan's support after breaking up with her latest boyfriend, so she enlists Roger to solve her meddling relative's romantic woes.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: He's Too Sexy for His Fat.
programme.desc: Chris grows increasingly uncomfortable with his weight and visits a cosmetic surgeon to arrange liposuction. However, it is Peter who ends up having the procedure - and his new appearance causes him to become vain and self-obsessed.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter learns his house on Spooner Street is not officially a part of the United States, and decides to take drastic action - by establishing his own country and declaring war on America.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine encourages Stan to open up emotionally, but gets more than she bargained for when he reveals a dark secret concerning the fate of a neighbour's husband. As the revelations continue to emerge, Roger takes it upon himself to play psychiatrist to the pair.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is asked to smoke out a former KGB agent and is shocked to discover the spy has not only moved in next door, but has also converted Steve into a communist. Meanwhile, Klaus is caught smuggling drugs on his way to France.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter tries to help Meg in her bid to become a reporter for the school newspaper by writing an article falsely claiming actor Luke Perry, who guest stars as himself, is gay. Meanwhile, Stewie builds a device that brings Chris under his power. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and his friends go on an extended drinking binge in a bid to win a tour of the local brewery - but their bad behaviour lands them in trouble with owner Pawtucket Pat, who bears more than a passing resemblance to Willy Wonka. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger releases photographs of himself to the media, prompting the CIA to form an Alien Task Force to deal with the situation. A twist of fate sees the authorities place the hapless extraterrestrial in charge of the operation - and his new position makes him one of Stan's superiors. Meanwhile, Francine gets to grips with being left-handed.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: Stanny Slickers 2: The Legend of Ollie's Gold.
programme.desc: A close encounter with death prompts Stan to put his dream of finding Oliver North's buried treasure into effect, and he heads off in search of fame and fortune. At home, Steve creates a robotic girlfriend, and Hayley turns to body piercing.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigate when a mysterious, fast-spreading illness strikes children from military families. While Gibbs investigates the cause, Abby and Jimmy partner with the Naval Medical Research Centre in the hope of delivering a cure before the holidays. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed by a stolen surveillance drone and the team links it to elusive terrorist Benham Parsa. NCIS joins forces with the Department of Defence to track down the device before it is used for a large-scale attack, but Gibbs is less than pleased that he has to work with his ex-lover Hollis Mann. Meanwhile, McGee hopes he will be granted time off to attend a black-tie gala honouring his girlfriend Delilah. Guest starring Susanna Thompson (Arrow).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In an effort to find the terrorist Parsa, Gibbs and the NCIS team track down one of his cohorts using evidence gleaned from the drone attack which has killed six people and wounded a further 22. Meanwhile, an emotionally shaken McGee struggles with the ramifications of the incident. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, Sean Murray, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a port authority officer reveals Parsa's possible whereabouts as the team continues the hunt for the terrorist intent on wiping out NCIS. Bishop reveals her past association with the quarry and suggests where she thinks he may be found, but the CIA has intercepted a call that places Parsa in a different location to Ellie's hunch. Mark Harmon and Emily Wickersham star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers faulty bulletproof vests in an abandoned truck filled with stolen USMC merchandise, and attempts to locate the source of the cargo and any vests that could have been sent to military personnel overseas. Crime drama, guest starring Challen Cates, with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane suspects a blogger's fascination with serial killers may have led him to commit murder in an attempt to achieve a twisted kind of fame. Unfortunately the FBI takes over the case before he can gather enough evidence to make an arrest, prompting him to try another strategy. Aware that the suspect craves publicity, he arranges for him to appear on a TV talk show. Directed by and starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is called to a nightclub car park where an undercover policewoman has been shot, and discovers she was trying to obtain incriminating evidence against a drug kingpin - whose henchmen later kidnap him. His only chance of escape lies in playing a psychological game with the dead woman's partner, who appears to have begun to identify with her underworld contacts so closely that she has changed sides and become a criminal.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A former American football star's assistant dies in a car bomb, which Jane believes was intended for the sportsman, so he sets up a ruse to make the killer believe the attack was successful and the athlete is dead. The team compiles a list of suspects and tries to draw out the criminal at a memorial service, but the investigators uncover a long list of enemies with different motives. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is called to the scene of a fireman's death, but is knocked unconscious while searching for the murder weapon and almost drowns in a pond, which causes him to lose his memory and revert to his former con-artist self. Rigsby takes him under his wing, convinced the only way to get him firing on all cylinders again is to bring him back into the CBI fold. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A lawyer is killed in an explosion on his boat, leaving the team to find out that he was accused of cheating by a mob boss, so Cho goes undercover at one of the criminal's gaming nights to see what he can learn. Back at CBI headquarters, FBI Agent Darcy has been assigned to re-examine the case of serial killer Panzer, but Jane believes her life is in danger when Red John sends them doctored footage of her. Crime drama, guest starring Catherine Dent and Rudolf Martin, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The team tackles jury bias against a woman on trial for the murder of a star athlete, who she previously accused of assaulting her. Meanwhile, Benny encounters an old flame.(n)

programme.desc: Tensions are on the rise at Gate Station, as a violent riot erupts, bringing the citizens and the police into conflict. Crime drama, starring Sanaa Lathan and Stephan James.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Clouseau
programme.desc: The famously inept but accidentally brilliant Inspector Clouseau returns to help foil a group of daring robbers in this comedy, the only film in the long-running series not to feature Peter Sellers as the bumbling inspector. Instead, the talented Alan Arkin assumes the role, blundering his way through the expected series of absurd, slapstick situations. The plot centers on a series of Swiss bank robberies under investigation by an uptight Scotland Yard inspector (Patrick Cargill), who naturally becomes infuriated by Clouseau's unwelcome intervention. Meanwhile, the robbers decide to confuse matters by wearing Clouseau masks, offering further opportunities for farcical mistaken identities. Due to the absence of both Sellers and director Blake Edwards, Inspector Clouseau has largely been forgotten in comparison to the other Pink Panther films, though it maintains some interest as a curious aberration in the popular comic series(n)

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
programme.desc: A group of interstellar outlaws team up to save the galaxy from a villain who seeks ultimate power in this comic book space adventure from Marvel Studios and director James Gunn (Slither, Super). Peter Quill was just a young boy when, devastated by his mother's death, he sprinted out of the hospital and was swept into the stars by Yondu (Michael Rooker), the leader of an eclectic band of space scavengers known as The Ravagers. Twenty-six years later, Quill has adopted the nickname Star Lord (Chris Pratt). He's broken away from The Ravagers in an attempt to track down an ancient orb that is also coveted by the evil Ronan (Lee Pace), who is in league with the dreaded Thanos, and who dispatches his top assassin Gamora (Zoe Saldana) to retrieve it from Star Lord. In the process of doing so, Gamora also gets drawn into a fight with furry bounty hunter Rocket (voice of Bradley Cooper) and his tree-like, humanoid companion Groot (voice of Vin Diesel). Subsequently thrown into prison, this unlikely quartet quickly makes the acquaintance of fearsome warrior Drax the Destroyer (Dave Bautista), who seeks bitter revenge for the slaughter of his entire family at the hands of Ronan. In the process of making a daring prison break, Star Lord, Gamora, Rocket, Groot, and Drax recover the orb, and transport it to The Collector (Benecio Del Toro), who reveals that it houses an Infinity Gem - one of six precious stones that harbors incredible powers that could pose a dire threat should they fall into the wrong hands. Later, Ronan acquires the Infinity Gem and plots to use its power to destroy The Nova Corps home-world of Xandar, The Guardians of the Galaxy must race through the stars to recover it before Ronan can carry out his genocidal plan(n)

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and Chris Pine star in this intense action thriller, the final work to be directed by the late Tony Scott. Veteran railroad employee Frank Barnes has his quarrels with the young, new guy on the job, Will Colson - largely because the younger man is about to replace him. But the two must join forces and race against time when an enormous runaway train carrying toxic chemicals heads their way. If its terminal destination in a city wasn't bad enough, the lethal behemoth is also on the same line as another train, aboard which are 150 children who are returning from a school trip. When the railroad company's chairman refuses to take action for financial reasons, Frank takes it upon himself to save the day, despite the seemingly suicidal nature of the mission and the devastating consequences it's likely to have for his loved ones. Will opposes Frank's ridiculously dangerous idea, but joins him anyway. Can the two men patch up their differences and save the day? In addition to the nail-biting action, the score beautifully highlights the suspense, and earned the film a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Sound Editing(n)

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
programme.desc: A group of interstellar outlaws team up to save the galaxy from a villain who seeks ultimate power in this comic book space adventure from Marvel Studios and director James Gunn (Slither, Super). Peter Quill was just a young boy when, devastated by his mother's death, he sprinted out of the hospital and was swept into the stars by Yondu (Michael Rooker), the leader of an eclectic band of space scavengers known as The Ravagers. Twenty-six years later, Quill has adopted the nickname Star Lord (Chris Pratt). He's broken away from The Ravagers in an attempt to track down an ancient orb that is also coveted by the evil Ronan (Lee Pace), who is in league with the dreaded Thanos, and who dispatches his top assassin Gamora (Zoe Saldana) to retrieve it from Star Lord. In the process of doing so, Gamora also gets drawn into a fight with furry bounty hunter Rocket (voice of Bradley Cooper) and his tree-like, humanoid companion Groot (voice of Vin Diesel). Subsequently thrown into prison, this unlikely quartet quickly makes the acquaintance of fearsome warrior Drax the Destroyer (Dave Bautista), who seeks bitter revenge for the slaughter of his entire family at the hands of Ronan. In the process of making a daring prison break, Star Lord, Gamora, Rocket, Groot, and Drax recover the orb, and transport it to The Collector (Benecio Del Toro), who reveals that it houses an Infinity Gem - one of six precious stones that harbors incredible powers that could pose a dire threat should they fall into the wrong hands. Later, Ronan acquires the Infinity Gem and plots to use its power to destroy The Nova Corps home-world of Xandar, The Guardians of the Galaxy must race through the stars to recover it before Ronan can carry out his genocidal plan(n)

programme.desc: During a visit to Cleveland, Ohio, Adam Richman tries to finish the Melt Bar and Grilled restaurant's 5lb grilled-cheese sandwich challenge.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares raspberry shortcakes.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares a roast beef and horseradish sandwich for lunch.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten helps a bride-to be who is having problems planning her rehearsal dinner. She prepares two desserts while Miguel Flores-Vianna designs two table settings.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Running a store isn't easy, and Ina should know - she ran a deli for 20 years. Ina suggests a French-inspired menu of Provencal soup, seafood and coconut madeleines for dessert as a staff thank you.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares recipes for four desserts, including a white chocolate pudding, a fast raspberry fool, a quick dessert panini, and caramel apple sauce to make a sundae.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Easter on the ranch starts with a Good Friday delivery of hot cross buns to friends. Ree makes tortellini primavera and 'krispy' eggs, with a basket of crudites and a spinach dip.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While the family works cattle, Ree Drummond fills the freezer with components ready to turn into meals at a moment's notice.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Kitchen Confessional: Dinner Through the Decades.
programme.desc: Ree Drummond confesses about her life on a plate, from beef stroganoff that she loved as a child of the 70s, to pasta ai quattro formaggi that defined her student life in LA.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: The chef continues his campaign to improve the diets of the people of Rotherham. Jamie's pupils struggle to apply their new cooking skills to their home lives, and he attends a Rotherham United football match to show that even the most unlikely of people can take part in his culinary revolution - including a local miner who has never prepared a meal in his life.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples southern staples with a twist in Vancouver, including pulled pork pancakes with a side of Jack Daniel's syrup.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a chef serving homemade pretzels with a special beer and cheese sauce in Manhattan, New York.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri tries a duck club sandwich with home-made garlic mayo in Charleston, South Carolina.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a British-style fish and chip shop in Santa Barbara that serves classic UK dishes including haggis and toad-in-the-hole.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a Greek diner in Dundalk, Maryland that serves up family recipes, along with a restaurant in Oxnard, California which bakes, brews and cooks.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a Chinese restaurant using family recipes in Vancouver, British Columbia where they hand-pull noodles.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a local deli in Santa Barbara, California, famous with locals and celebrities that serves traditional pastrami.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Two Irish brothers in Annapolis, Maryland served up food from their homeland with a twist including Guinness-fried oysters with homemade coleslaw.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri and former Super Bowl champion Joe Theismann visit a taqueria in Baltimore.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri continues his culinary adventure as he samples a Tex-Mex selection of savoury soups in Dallas.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits the east coast of Oahu, Hawaii, where the general store serves traditional dishes including lau lau stew.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: New series. The young chefs have to butcher and cook snakes in the appetiser round, but some may be too squeamish to let their skills shine through.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: The chef continues his campaign to improve the diets of the people of Rotherham. Jamie's pupils struggle to apply their new cooking skills to their home lives, and he attends a Rotherham United football match to show that even the most unlikely of people can take part in his culinary revolution - including a local miner who has never prepared a meal in his life.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The 1980s pop star Tiffany goes undercover as a Mystery Diner.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps a father and daughter working in a struggling restaurant, where the father could lose the business and his relationship with his daughter.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps the owner of The Stress Factory comedy club in New Brunswic. The owner, Vinnie, is watching the 20-year-old restaurant and comedy club quickly sink.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A couple's ordinary life is transformed by the intervention of MI5.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: MI5 use Peter's home as a safe house for a Russian defector, leaving him with a major diplomatic incident on his hands.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household echoes to the sound of laughter, as Margaret joins the local amateur dramatic society and Victor begins penning a sitcom script. However, his mother-in-law's bath-time accident and a run-in with British Telecom soon leave the curmudgeonly codger in no mood for jokes. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Lair of the Cat Creature.
programme.desc: A hang-gliding enthusiast crashes down in the village, mistakenly believing that he's landed in France, thus breaking the long-distance record. The gang tries to compensate for his disappointment by making him the best at something else - identifying a strange cat creature lurking in the woods. Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly and Clegg are enlightened in the wisdom of the East by an electrical handyman from Hull, and Howard struggles to keep his self-styled bandit persona alive. Meanwhile, a debt-collector is an unwelcome guest for Tom.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty.
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barraclough uncover the stash in his cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels, and the only way to discover their contents is to open them. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright buys a dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear.
programme.desc: Arkwright's regular customers are upset by his habit of continually dragging Granville around by the ear in an attempt to toughen him up. Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A man who emigrated to Australia decades earlier, and was known to have a soft spot for Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, plans to pay a return visit to his former haunts - making Arkwright fear that he will try to rekindle old passions. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville and Gastric try to get Madge into the festive spirit by organising a cosy drinks party. Meanwhile, a bargain Christmas tree causes problems, Nurse Gladys discusses tactics for her new job with Mrs Featherstone and Eric and Cyril attempt to impress their wives with a healthy living plan. Christmas edition of the comedy, starring David Jason, Lynda Baron and Tim Healy.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville organises a cut-price sale - but only as a means to get rid of old stock - while Nurse Gladys is reunited with a former patient. Romance is in the air in the neighbourhood, as Mrs Featherstone has her eye on a new arrival while Mavis tries to reignite Granville's passion over a cup of coffee.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville discovers a gap in the shop's security, and Madge is made anxious by a cherry picker - while a neighbour's home cooking threatens the penny-pinching shopkeeper's plans to matchmake her and Gastric. Meanwhile, Eric and Kath make plans to spend some time together.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The four students decide to throw a party, but before long it descends into chaos. Rick desperately tries to impress his favourite lecturer, Mike chats up a fairytale princess, Vyvyan's fellow punks start a riot, and Neil gets beaten up, while other guests include the four horsemen of the Apocalypse, a giant sandwich, a singing tomato and Santa. Comedy first broadcast in 1982, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson, with music by Rip Rig and Panic.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Mr Balowski becomes a mad axeman and chases the bachelor boys into Narnia as a flood of biblical proportions engulfs London. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Adrian Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: The installation of a hi-tech security system sounds like just the thing to protect the shop - but it is not long before Manny gets trapped inside, leaving Bernard out in the cold. Fortunately, things go a little better for Fran, who is reunited with an old flame. Comedy, starring Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, guest starring Nick Frost and Peter Serafinowicz.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Manny runs away to escape bookshop owner Bernard's relentless bossiness, but finds life on the streets far tougher than he anticipated - especially when he becomes the object of a photographer's desire. Comedy, starring Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, with Omid Djalili.(n)

programme.title: Bill Hicks Live: Revelations
programme.desc: A 1993 performance by the outspoken American stand-up comedian, recorded at the Dominion Theatre in London. Hicks rattles through his opinions and observations on Los Angeles, how much he misses smoking, politician George W Bush, the first Iraq war, the assassination of JFK, pop music, television and children on planes.(n)

programme.title: Garth Marenghi's Darkplace
programme.desc: Dr Rick Dagless is on the trail of a virulent disease spreading from ward to ward, which causes humans to regress to a primal state. He must put a stop to its progress before the beast within is unleashed. Matthew Holness stars.(n)

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: Bob hopes to defend his title of toupee wearer of the year, but the house rat runs off with his wig on the day of the awards and he offers a golden ticket to the person who can retrieve the hairpiece in time for the celebrations. Just as all seems lost, Bob realises the secret to finding it is hidden in an unexpected place. Cowboy Builders presenter Dominic Littlewood appears as himself.(n)

programme.desc: The agents make a disastrous mistake during a mission, but a college lecturer helps to salvage the situation.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg.
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream.
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Miraculous Curing of Old Goff Helliwell.
programme.desc: When Clegg, Billy and Truly hear an old school friend is about to die, the trio search for something - or someone - to put the spark back into his life. Comedy, guest starring Henry McGee, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Keith Clifford.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville arranges a double date with Madge and Mavis for himself and Gastric - but has to smarten his friend up first. Mrs Featherstone has her eye on a potential new husband, Nurse Gladys is wooed by a man whose boil she once treated, while Eric and Cyril need to come up with some clever marketing ideas when a mysterious new product arrives in the shop.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: The neighbourhood prepares for a wedding, and Granville gets into the spirit of things by putting up a large display to bring a bit of cheeriness to his shop window. However, the reluctant groom has cold feet, and it falls to the miserly shopkeeper to ensure he makes it to the church on time. The marital atmosphere also has a marked effect on Mrs Featherstone, who steps up her search for a fourth husband - with Granville and Mr Newbold finding themselves likely candidates to be the next lucky man.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to sell some damaged tins of chilli beans and prove the erotic power of salami, but finds himself confronted with a customer's unhappy husband. Cyril and Eric seek advice on how to impress their wives, while Mrs Featherstone's efforts to secure Mr Newbold as a fourth husband suffer a setback.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: James takes a trip to York market, where he rustles up broccoli and almond soup, chicken with mustard spring greens and lemon syllabub.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: The chef travels to Masham in North Yorkshire, where he prepares haunch of venison with asparagus, and cauliflower cheese.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares roast shoulder of lamb with all the trimmings, before turning the leftovers into Moroccan-style crispy pastillas, and makes good use of stale bread by using it as part of a panzanella salad. The chef also shows a lover of takeaways how to dish up a beef rendang from the remains of a cut of brisket, and helps two people reduce their food waste.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates wallet-friendly recipes for pot-roasted ham hocks, squash and spinach rotolo, and steak and chips, and shows a takeaway lover how to make sweet and sour fish balls for a fraction of the price of her favourite Chinese treat. The chef also inspires a pair of food wasters to make good use of all their leftover salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals for around £1.55 a portion. He cooks up a roast side of salmon with all the trimmings and uses the leftovers in a filo pie, before showing a takeaway lover how to make a lamb burger for a fraction of the price of his usual Friday night fast-food treat. Plus, a woman receives tips on putting unwanted bread to good use.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up a frugal paella with chicken thighs, spicy chorizo and prawns, and uses leftovers from a Sunday roast pork to make midweek crispy Mexican tacos and French Vietnamese banh mi. Plus, Sicilian-inspired meatballs and tomato `Norma' sauce and a twist on beans on toast with broad beans and peas from the freezer. The chef also demonstrates how to reap the benefits of a well-stocked store cupboard.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Penang, Malaysia, to sample its multifaceted cuisine, which includes Malay, Indian, Chinese and British flavours. He also meets food writer Fay Khoo to explore the popularity of the region's fish-head curry, before crossing the Indian Ocean to Sri Lanka, where he visits a bustling fishing village and takes part in an unusual expedition.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The seafood chef continues to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures with a visit to Sri Lanka, where he discovers a wealth of hot and spicy vegetable curries. He then ventures on to Bali and finds food has a religious significance on the island, before sampling what he believes is the best roast pork he has ever tasted.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef ends his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures by visiting Bangladesh, sampling the curry on offer in the country that has played a major role in establishing the success of Indian restaurants throughout the UK.(n)

programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Penang, Malaysia, to sample its multifaceted cuisine, which includes Malay, Indian, Chinese and British flavours. He also meets food writer Fay Khoo to explore the popularity of the region's fish-head curry, before crossing the Indian Ocean to Sri Lanka, where he visits a bustling fishing village and takes part in an unusual expedition.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The seafood chef continues to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures with a visit to Sri Lanka, where he discovers a wealth of hot and spicy vegetable curries. He then ventures on to Bali and finds food has a religious significance on the island, before sampling what he believes is the best roast pork he has ever tasted.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef ends his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures by visiting Bangladesh, sampling the curry on offer in the country that has played a major role in establishing the success of Indian restaurants throughout the UK.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares roast shoulder of lamb with all the trimmings, before turning the leftovers into Moroccan-style crispy pastillas, and makes good use of stale bread by using it as part of a panzanella salad. The chef also shows a lover of takeaways how to dish up a beef rendang from the remains of a cut of brisket, and helps two people reduce their food waste.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates wallet-friendly recipes for pot-roasted ham hocks, squash and spinach rotolo, and steak and chips, and shows a takeaway lover how to make sweet and sour fish balls for a fraction of the price of her favourite Chinese treat. The chef also inspires a pair of food wasters to make good use of all their leftover salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals for around £1.55 a portion. He cooks up a roast side of salmon with all the trimmings and uses the leftovers in a filo pie, before showing a takeaway lover how to make a lamb burger for a fraction of the price of his usual Friday night fast-food treat. Plus, a woman receives tips on putting unwanted bread to good use.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up a frugal paella with chicken thighs, spicy chorizo and prawns, and uses leftovers from a Sunday roast pork to make midweek crispy Mexican tacos and French Vietnamese banh mi. Plus, Sicilian-inspired meatballs and tomato `Norma' sauce and a twist on beans on toast with broad beans and peas from the freezer. The chef also demonstrates how to reap the benefits of a well-stocked store cupboard.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Spring arrives at the farm, bringing 11 new piglets and a pair of lambs. Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall hunts for morel mushrooms, which he plans to use in a terrine to enter in a competition for the best picnic. He also gets a lesson in bread-making from a master baker, and hopes to sell the end results at the local cider festival.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall investigates the possibility of installing beehives at the farm - but his fear of being stung proves a stumbling block. He also takes on the challenge of providing the catering for a 70-strong wedding party who only want to be served wild or home-grown produce.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall teams up with a fisherman from Lyme Regis to catch whelks and cook them for sale on Dorset's beaches on carnival day. He also plans an event to celebrate the success of his tomato crop, complete with a ketchup-making contest and an unusual new flavour of ice-cream.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall collects the first crop of honey from his hives, enlisting the help of an apiarist to avoid being stung, and enrolling in bee-keeping classes to get more out of his harvest. He also takes a steer to slaughter, and tries to improve the reputation of tripe with the general public at the local farmers' market.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall plans a menu for an autumn feast, featuring young cockerels as the main course - but has difficulty working out which chicks are the males. He also enlists the help of a local potter in creating chicken bricks, to ensure the meat turns out tender, and goes on a hunt for the last wild mushrooms of the season.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recounts his early days as a smallholder, beginning with his arrival in Dorset, where he soon learned the importance of knowing the locals who now supply him with food for his table. Also featured are several of the recipes Hugh conjures up, including watercress and wild garlic soup.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recalls the development of his horticultural skills in Dorset, from the planting of his first organic vegetable patches to harvesting bumper crops from his polytunnels, and offers tips on how to come out on top at the local agricultural show.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Smallholder Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates his love of pigs and pork, guiding viewers through every stage of his dealings with his sows, from how to buy a pig to how to cure the meat. Also featured is Hugh's beloved breeding sow Delia.(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: John Farley (Sean William Scott) has overcome years of childhood and teenage humiliation and has fashioned himself into a self-help author who guides others towards releasing their painful memories and rebuilding their self-esteem. However, his miserable past sneaks up on him when he returns to his hometown only to find that his mother is marrying Mr. Woodcock (Billy Bob Thornton), the tough gym teacher who was the source of his school years' woes. Determined to stop his mother from marrying the man who made school a living hell for him, John is going to need all the self-help he can get. The cast of this outrageous comedy is rounded up by Susan Sarandon, Amy Poehler and Ethan Suplee(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: This mockumentary satire of the music business and modern celebrity centers on self-absorbed pop rapper Conner4Real (Andy Samberg). Once a member of a popular rap trio called the Style Boyz, Conner is now a solo artist about to drop his second album. Unfortunately, the release gets abysmal reviews, and his career begins to melt down when his attempts at rehabing his image lead to such disasters as a global blackout and a proposal to his girlfriend interrupted by a wolf attack. Eventually, Conner considers burying the hatchet with former colleagues Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) in order to reunite the Style Boyz. Tim Meadows, Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, and Imogen Poots co-star. Samberg, Taccone, and Schaffer co-wrote the screenplay, while Taccone and Schaffer shared directing duties(n)

programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Action tale adapted from the popular video game in which the eponymous heroine races against time to find an ancient relic before it falls into the wrong hands. programme.desc: Poignant story of a troubled young genius who finds his allegiance to his friends and blue-collar background challenged by new opportunities. Ben Affleck and Matt Damon's screenplay won an Oscar(n)

programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Plan B. Said (Eamonn Walker) recovers surprisingly quickly from his heart attack, and punishes the power-hungry Huseni Mershaw (Roger Guenveur Smith) for not helping him. "This man is cast out!" Said tells his fellow Muslims, and Mershaw, despite an entreaty to Adebisi (Adewale Akinnouye-Agbaje), finds himself isolated. In desperation, he goes to McManus (Terry Kinney) and Glynn (Ernie Hudson), telling them that Said is planning a riot. This sets off a shakedown in Em City, and Mershaw is branded a snitch. Before his transfer out of Em City, he tearfully tells Said, "All you taught me was that your God is full of hate and vengeance." Mershaw is later found dead, an apparent suicide. Said talks to the press about the string of recent deaths in Oz, causing Glynn to cut off his access to the media, and crack down on the Muslim population in retribution. Said's power impresses Groves (Sean Whitesell), who tells him, "The whole Allah thing -- it's awesome," and is inspired to kill Warden Glynn. His murder attempt fails, and he ends up inadvertently killing a guard who intercedes. Sentenced to death for this murder, he asks to be executed by firing squad. Hill (Harold Perrineau) is still struggling with his drug problem, thanks to the influence of Mayhew (Rick Fox), but he finds solace in helping a fellow inmate, Dobbins (Zuill Bailey), who is an accomplished young cellist. Beecher (Lee Tergesen) returns to Em City after doing time in the hole for his PCP-induced attack on Schillinger (J.K. Simmons). Harassed by Schillinger's Nazi cohorts, he requests a transfer, but is denied. Pushed to the breaking point, he takes his ugly revenge on Schillinger(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: A Game of Checkers. Ross blackmails Wittlesey; Schillinger returns to Em City; and two inmates get into a fight, which escalates into a riot. It's "our worst nightmare," says Glenn(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie," a 2016 adaptation of the popular British sitcom about hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy, who flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. The film stars Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, and is directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Brothers try to raise money for a Chicago orphanage by getting their blues band back together(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: C.S. Lewis's beloved fantasy novels come to life in this enchanting adventure. Dazzling special effects highlight the story of four British children who enter a magical world, where they befriend wondrous creatures and battle a witch (Tilda Swinton). Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, William Moseley, Anna Popplewell. Directed by Andrew Adamson(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: An English teenager dreams of soccer stardom, against the wishes of her traditional Sikh family(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Longing to discover the identity of her true father before she exchanges her wedding vows, the daughter of a once-rebellious single mother secretly invites a trio of paternal candidates to her upcoming wedding in this feature adaptation of the beloved stage musical. Independent-minded single mother Donna (Meryl Streep) has always done her best to raise her spirited daughter, Sophie (Amanda Seyfried), while simultaneously running a successful hotel on a small Greek island, but now the time has come for this hardworking mom to finally let go. In just a few days, Sophie will be married, and Donna will stand by bittersweetly as her little girl takes flight. Of course, Donna's lifelong friends Rosie (Julie Walters) and Tanya (Christine Baranski) will both be present at the wedding, but unbeknownst to the mother, Sophie has furtively invited three very special guests of her own. When Sophie walks down the aisle on that fateful day, she wants her father to hand her off. The only problem is that Donna has never revealed the true identity of Sophie's father, leaving the resourceful future bride to narrow the list down to three potential candidates. Now, as three key figures from Donna's past return to the picturesque Mediterranean shores they all walked 20 years prior, one beautiful bride will discover the secret of her past while one lonely mother finds out that it's never too late for a little romance. Phyllida Lloyd, director of both the original London sensation as well as the hit Broadway incarnation, makes her feature directorial debut with this big-screen version of the beloved musical featuring 22 classic ABBA hits. Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth, Stellan Skarsgård, and Dominic Cooper co-star(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: Freeman is hired to chauffeur the difficult Tandy in racially tense 1960's South. The two develop an eventual relationship and love for each other with terrific performances across the board and enough sincerity to break even the toughest audience(n)

programme.title: Making of 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood plays Will Munny, a rancher who gave up his bullets for pig farming long ago. He's forced out of retirement by the search for money to feed his children, but struggles with his past and the fear of a return to his old, murdering ways. Gene Hackman turns in a powerful performance as the corrupt sherriff who deals brutally with the bounty hunters and taunts Munny by comparing their need for violence. Eastwood undermines his Man With No Name persona and plays effectively on his grey-haired appearance. This is a bold and compelling Western(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A professional thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Movie mogul and former gangster Chili Palmer is itching for a new project. He decides to make his first foray into the music business - but his ambition to turn a female performer into a star leaves him with a price on his head(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A young boy discovers a peculiar island, where he finds a community of children with special abilities, after following a sequence of clues and must protect them(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: Old-fashioned, melodramatic love story in which a singing superstar takes on a bodyguard to defend her against someone who is trying to kill her. Sparks fly when the feisty singer and her uncompromising protector cannot see eye to eye about anything, but the friction also kindles romance. Whitney Houston's debut film role. With a clutch of hits including 'I Will Always Love You'(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonizing that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change
programme.desc: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change. A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Britney Spears made her big-screen debut (and even gets to sing) in this amiable road movie. Plucky 18-year-old Lucy (Spears) takes two high-school friends on a trip out West, where she hopes to reunite with her mom (Kim Cattrall). Anson Mount, Zoe Saldana, Taryn Manning, Dan Aykroyd, Justin Long(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Eddie Mannix is a Hollywood 'fixer', and is part of the upcoming production starring superstar actor Baird Whitlock. When Whitlock is kidnapped, it is up to Mannix to collect his ransom and rescue him before the media finds out(n)

programme.title: Suited
programme.desc: A look at a tailoring company in Brooklyn that provides custom attire for LGBTQ clients features profiles of the owners and the diverse community they serve. Lena Dunham and Jenni Konner ("Girls") are producers(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: When a bumbling movie lover becomes magnetized while attempting to sabotage a local power plant and accidentally erases all of the videotapes in the small video store where his best friend works, the pair attempt to keep the store's loyal customer base by remaking as many of the top-renting movies as possible. Mike (Mos Def) is an employee at Be Kind Rewind, a modest mom and pop video store that is owned by Mr. Fletcher (Danny Glover). Mike's best friend Jerry (Jack Black) works in an auto garage/junkyard directly adjacent to a local power plant. Lately Jerry has become increasingly paranoid about the effects that the power plant is having on his health. Convinced that he has developed a brain tumor from working in such close proximity to the power plant, Jerry attempts to sabotage the plant. Unfortunately for Jerry, his brain is magnetized in the process. The next time Jerry goes to visit Mike at Be Kind Rewind, the powerful magnetization emanating from his brain erases every videotape in the store. Now the only way for Mike and Jerry to be sure that Be Kind Rewind stays in business is to remake every film on the shelves before the customers notice. But when word gets out that Mike and Jerry have remade such Hollywood classics as Back to the Future, Robocop, The Lion King, and Rush Hour without permission, the store is threatened with copyright violations and forced to close its doors. In the aftermath of the closing, Mr. Fletcher and his employees discover just how loyal their customers really are when the entire neighborhood pools their resources to transform the junkyard into a legitimate movie studio and produce an entirely original film detailing the incredible adventures of a local jazz legend(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Sinclair Broadcast Group. The Sinclair Broadcast Group and its ownership of local U.S. television stations; and Donald Trump's tweets about Mika Brzezinski are discussed(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: The Huntsman and his secret lover Sara attempt to stop Freya the Ice Queen and her evil sister from conquering the forest(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Jamal Malik is one question away from winning 20 million rupees in the Indian version of the TV quiz show Who Wants to Be A Millionaire?. As he answers correctly one question after another, the producers suspect he is cheating and have him arrested. The police agents questioning him cannot believe that a slumdog like him can have the knowledge to win the prize and become a millionaire overnight. While trying to prove them it is destiny that placed him there, Jamal will take us back to the events of his childhood that have the clue to the answers. We will learn about how he and his little brother strived to survive in the mean streets of Mumbai and how he met Latika, his one true love. He entered the show knowing she would be watching it and now every question brings him closer to her(n)

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire
programme.desc: Gothic horror story based on Anne Rice's novel about a 200-year-old vampire who decides to tell his life story to an increasingly beguiled journalist in modern-day San Francisco. Weary with wandering the world in search of fresh prey, the vampire begins to relate episodes from his past embracing two centuries(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Capital P. The governor (Zeljko Ivanek) reinstates capital punishment---just in time for Jefferson Keane (Leon) to be sentenced to death for the Martinez killing. Sister Pete: Rita Moreno. Said: Eamonn Walker. Father Mukada: B.D. Wong. Glynn: Ernie Hudson. McManus: Terry Kinney(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Straight Life. The drug trade at Oz is thriving, and McManus (Terry Kinney) wants to stop it. He offers Schibetta (Tony Musante) a deal to testify against the suppliers. When Schibetta refuses, McManus transfers all the other Italians out of Em City, leaving the capo isolated. Pressured by his new partners, Markstram (O.L. Duke) and Adebisi (Adewale Akinnouye-Agbaje), Schibetta tells them the drugs are coming through the post office. The manipulative O'Reily (Dean Winters) overhears the information, and passes it along to Pokelwaldt (Brian Tarantina), a snitch. Then Markstram turns up dead in his cell, and Glynn (Ernie Hudson) belatedly tells McManus that the dead man was an undercover cop. McManus tells Diane (Edie Falco) that he loves her, but she says their night of passion was a mistake. A new prisoner arrives, Scott Ross (Stephen Gevedon), who has a history with Diane. She lets him know he'll get no special treatment, but when her overtime is cut, she's financially strapped, and agrees to help Ross smuggle cigarettes into Oz. Said (Eamon Walker) is suffering from hypertension, but refuses to take medication that might dull his mind. Schibetta asks O'Reily to help him eliminate competition by shutting down the guards' drug operation. O'Reily accomplishes this by convincing Pokelwaldt to rat on him when he makes a deal with his drug-running partner, Officer Healy (Steve Ryan). O'Reily gets thrown in the hole for a month and Healy gets fired. Sister Pete (Rita Moreno) gets Beecher (Lee Tergensen) to enter drug counseling, but he has a panic attack and races out during his first session. Schillinger (J. K. Simmons) continues to torment Beecher, making him wear lipstick and dress like a woman(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: To Your Health. A basketball star who was convicted of assault and attempted rape arrives at Em City. Meanwhile, Rebadow (George Morfogen) is beaten and Ricardo Alvarez (Tomas Milian) is diagnosed with Alzheimer's. Nathan: Lauren Velez. Reimondo: Rita Moreno(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Plan B. Said (Eamonn Walker) recovers surprisingly quickly from his heart attack, and punishes the power-hungry Huseni Mershaw (Roger Guenveur Smith) for not helping him. "This man is cast out!" Said tells his fellow Muslims, and Mershaw, despite an entreaty to Adebisi (Adewale Akinnouye-Agbaje), finds himself isolated. In desperation, he goes to McManus (Terry Kinney) and Glynn (Ernie Hudson), telling them that Said is planning a riot. This sets off a shakedown in Em City, and Mershaw is branded a snitch. Before his transfer out of Em City, he tearfully tells Said, "All you taught me was that your God is full of hate and vengeance." Mershaw is later found dead, an apparent suicide. Said talks to the press about the string of recent deaths in Oz, causing Glynn to cut off his access to the media, and crack down on the Muslim population in retribution. Said's power impresses Groves (Sean Whitesell), who tells him, "The whole Allah thing -- it's awesome," and is inspired to kill Warden Glynn. His murder attempt fails, and he ends up inadvertently killing a guard who intercedes. Sentenced to death for this murder, he asks to be executed by firing squad. Hill (Harold Perrineau) is still struggling with his drug problem, thanks to the influence of Mayhew (Rick Fox), but he finds solace in helping a fellow inmate, Dobbins (Zuill Bailey), who is an accomplished young cellist. Beecher (Lee Tergesen) returns to Em City after doing time in the hole for his PCP-induced attack on Schillinger (J.K. Simmons). Harassed by Schillinger's Nazi cohorts, he requests a transfer, but is denied. Pushed to the breaking point, he takes his ugly revenge on Schillinger(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: A Game of Checkers. Ross blackmails Wittlesey; Schillinger returns to Em City; and two inmates get into a fight, which escalates into a riot. It's "our worst nightmare," says Glenn(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie," a 2016 adaptation of the popular British sitcom about hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy, who flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. The film stars Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, and is directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Brothers try to raise money for a Chicago orphanage by getting their blues band back together(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: C.S. Lewis's beloved fantasy novels come to life in this enchanting adventure. Dazzling special effects highlight the story of four British children who enter a magical world, where they befriend wondrous creatures and battle a witch (Tilda Swinton). Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, William Moseley, Anna Popplewell. Directed by Andrew Adamson(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: An English teenager dreams of soccer stardom, against the wishes of her traditional Sikh family(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Longing to discover the identity of her true father before she exchanges her wedding vows, the daughter of a once-rebellious single mother secretly invites a trio of paternal candidates to her upcoming wedding in this feature adaptation of the beloved stage musical. Independent-minded single mother Donna (Meryl Streep) has always done her best to raise her spirited daughter, Sophie (Amanda Seyfried), while simultaneously running a successful hotel on a small Greek island, but now the time has come for this hardworking mom to finally let go. In just a few days, Sophie will be married, and Donna will stand by bittersweetly as her little girl takes flight. Of course, Donna's lifelong friends Rosie (Julie Walters) and Tanya (Christine Baranski) will both be present at the wedding, but unbeknownst to the mother, Sophie has furtively invited three very special guests of her own. When Sophie walks down the aisle on that fateful day, she wants her father to hand her off. The only problem is that Donna has never revealed the true identity of Sophie's father, leaving the resourceful future bride to narrow the list down to three potential candidates. Now, as three key figures from Donna's past return to the picturesque Mediterranean shores they all walked 20 years prior, one beautiful bride will discover the secret of her past while one lonely mother finds out that it's never too late for a little romance. Phyllida Lloyd, director of both the original London sensation as well as the hit Broadway incarnation, makes her feature directorial debut with this big-screen version of the beloved musical featuring 22 classic ABBA hits. Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth, Stellan Skarsgård, and Dominic Cooper co-star(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: Freeman is hired to chauffeur the difficult Tandy in racially tense 1960's South. The two develop an eventual relationship and love for each other with terrific performances across the board and enough sincerity to break even the toughest audience(n)

programme.title: Making of 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood plays Will Munny, a rancher who gave up his bullets for pig farming long ago. He's forced out of retirement by the search for money to feed his children, but struggles with his past and the fear of a return to his old, murdering ways. Gene Hackman turns in a powerful performance as the corrupt sherriff who deals brutally with the bounty hunters and taunts Munny by comparing their need for violence. Eastwood undermines his Man With No Name persona and plays effectively on his grey-haired appearance. This is a bold and compelling Western(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A professional thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Movie mogul and former gangster Chili Palmer is itching for a new project. He decides to make his first foray into the music business - but his ambition to turn a female performer into a star leaves him with a price on his head(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A young boy discovers a peculiar island, where he finds a community of children with special abilities, after following a sequence of clues and must protect them(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: Old-fashioned, melodramatic love story in which a singing superstar takes on a bodyguard to defend her against someone who is trying to kill her. Sparks fly when the feisty singer and her uncompromising protector cannot see eye to eye about anything, but the friction also kindles romance. Whitney Houston's debut film role. With a clutch of hits including 'I Will Always Love You'(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonizing that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change
programme.desc: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change. A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Britney Spears made her big-screen debut (and even gets to sing) in this amiable road movie. Plucky 18-year-old Lucy (Spears) takes two high-school friends on a trip out West, where she hopes to reunite with her mom (Kim Cattrall). Anson Mount, Zoe Saldana, Taryn Manning, Dan Aykroyd, Justin Long(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Eddie Mannix is a Hollywood 'fixer', and is part of the upcoming production starring superstar actor Baird Whitlock. When Whitlock is kidnapped, it is up to Mannix to collect his ransom and rescue him before the media finds out(n)

programme.title: Suited
programme.desc: A look at a tailoring company in Brooklyn that provides custom attire for LGBTQ clients features profiles of the owners and the diverse community they serve. Lena Dunham and Jenni Konner ("Girls") are producers(n)
